get.description:
A List of business partners
 - Requires: `API Tier 1`
 - Filterable fields: `worker_id`, `business_partner_group_id`
 - Expandable fields: `business_partner_group`, `worker`, `client_group`
 - Sortable fields: `id`, `created_at`, `updated_at`

next_link.description: A link to the next page of responses.

Retrieve supergroup inclusion members matching the input parameters.

street_address.description: The full street address component, which may include house number, street name, P.O. box, and multi-line extended street address information, pursuant to SCIM RFC 7643 4.1.2..

region.description: The state or region component, pursuant to SCIM RFC 7643 4.1.2.

postal_code.description: The zip code or postal code component, pursuant to SCIM RFC 7643 4.1.2.

country.description: The country component, pursuant to SCIM RFC 7643 4.1.2.

sin.description: Social Insurance Number (SIN) for Canada employees.

parent_legal_entity.description:
The company's ultimate holding entity.

Expandable field

legal_entities_id.description: A list of the company's entities.

legal_entities.description:
A list of the company's entities.

Expandable field

physical_address.description: The physical address of the holding entity.

primary_email.description: The email address used when registering this company.

legal_name.description: The legal name of the company.

doing_business_as_name.description: The doing business as name for the company.

phone.description: The phone number for the company.

name.description: The name of the company.

label.description: The display label of the employment type.

name.description: The name of the employment type for non-custom employment types.

type.description: The classification of the worker by the company. * `CONTRACTOR`: Contractors are self-employed workers who provide services on a short-term or per-project basis and are not eligible for tax-withholding or benefits. * `EMPLOYEE`: Employees are hired and managed by an employer, work under the employer's direct supervision and control, and are protected by law for wages and employment rights.

compensation_time_period.description: The compensation period for the employment type. * `SALARIED`: Employees that are paid a fixed amount per year. * `HOURLY`: Employees that are paid a wage per hour worked.

amount_worked.description: The amount worked for the employment type. * `FULL-TIME`: Full-time is at least 30 hours per week. Full-time workers will typically be eligible for benefits. * `PART-TIME`: Part-time is less than 30 hours per week. These workers may be eligible for benefits, depending on company settings and hours worked. * `TEMPORARY`: These workers are hired on a temporary basis. You can specify how each worker with this employment type will be paid individually.

annual_compensation.description: The worker's annual compensation. This calculation assumes 40-hour work weeks for workers with an hourly wage.

annual_salary_equivalent.description: The worker's annual salary equivalent, for insurance purposes. It will be equal to the worker's annual compensation, except for owners that are receiving no cashcompensation.

hourly_wage.description: The worker's hourly wage. This calculation assumes 40-hour work weeks for workers with fixed compensation.

monthly_compensation.description: The worker's monthly compensation. This calculation assumes 40-hour work weeks for workers with an hourly wage.

relocation_reimbursement.description: The worker's hourly wage. This calculation assumes 40-hour work weeks for workers with fixed compensation.

target_annual_bonus.description: The worker's target annual bonus amount.

weekly_compensation.description: The worker's weekly compensation. This calculation assumes 40-hour work weeks for workers with an hourly wage.

target_annual_bonus_percent.description: The worker's target annual bonus as a percent of annual compensation.

payment_type.description: The payment type for an worker's compensation.

payment_terms.description: The payment terms for an worker's compensation.

CreateBulkDraftHireResponse.description: Response model for bulk draft hire creation.

invalid_items.description: List of invalid draft hire requests

successful_results.description: Detailed results for each draft hire item

currency_type.description: The currency type, ex: USD, EUR, etc.

value.description: The decimal amount for the currency.

description.description: The description of the custom field.

required.description: Whether the custom field is required.

type.description: The data type of the custom field.

personal_info.description: Personal information for the draft hire candidate

DraftHire.description:
A draft hire represents a candidate who has been offered a position but hasn't started yet.

    This class provides Platform API access to draft hire data stored as RoleWithCompany instances
    in a candidate state, allowing external systems to create and manage draft hires.

DraftHireResult.description: Result for an individual draft hire creation.

reference_id.description: External reference ID from the request

draft_hire_id.description: Generated draft hire ID if successful

status.description: Status of the creation (success, error, warning)

errors.description: List of validation errors if any

display.description: The display value of the email address.

EmploymentInfo.description: Employment information for a draft hire.

cliffMonths.description: Number of cliff months before vesting begins

percentageInitialVesting.description: Percentage of initial vesting as decimal

work_email.description: The group member's associated work email address.

base_pay.description: Annual base pay for the headcount position

bonus.description: Annual bonus for the headcount position

commission.description: Annual on target commission for the headcount position

tax_and_benefits.description: Annual total taxes and benefits compensation for this headcount position

total_cash.description: Annual total cash compensation for the headcount position

total_equity.description: Annual total equity compensation for the headcount position

position_id.description: Position name for the headcount, for ex PID100037

position_type.description: Type of headcount position. `OPEN_HEADCOUNT` A headcount position that's not yet filled. `FUTURE_START` Headcount where a candidate is going through the hiring process, or an offer has been accepted, but the person has not yet started. `ACTIVE` Headcount where a candidate has been hired and started. `CLOSED` Headcount that's no longer available to fill.

position_sub_type.description: More granular classification of headcount position type. `NEW` New headcount created, typically paired with the OPEN_HEADCOUNT type. `BACKFILL` Replacement headcount for someone who left the company. `FORECASTED_ATTRITION` Headcount that does not count toward the budget, also known as provisional position in the application,  `HIRING_STAGE` Person is going through the hiring process, paired with the FUTURE_START type. `OFFER_STAGE` Offer has been extended to a candidate, awaiting their decision. Paired with the FUTURE_START type. `OFFER_ACCEPTED` Candidate has accepted the offer but has not yet started. Paired with the FUTURE_START type. `PLAN_CHANGE` Headcount status changed due to business decision. Paired with CLOSED type. `TERMINATED` Role was filled, but the employee was separated from the company. Paired with CLOSED type. `TRANSFERRED` Employee moved internally to another role. Paired with CLOSED type.

Department the headcount belongs to

grantor.description:

LeaveAccrual.description:
Leave accrual resource representing time off credits granted to employees.

    Leave accruals track the allocation of paid time off (vacation, sick days, etc.)
    to employees based on company policies, manual grants, or other accrual sources.

The company or organization associated with the legal entity

name.description: The name of the level. Must be unique within the company or organization.

global_level.description: Global level is used to track the seniority of levels. The higher up a level is placed on the page, the more senior and higher-ranked the level. Global level is used in workflows, policies, and reports that use the level attribute (e.g., you can use Level Lookup to set up a workflow that notifies the nearest person in an worker's management chain at or above the specified level).

rank.description: The rank of the level within its track.

track_id.description: The track associated with the level, if it's not a global level.

The track associated with the level, if it's not a global level.
